oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Constrained molecular dynamics is used to calculate the potentials of mean force for the exo and endo dissociation of 2-norbornyl chlorides in two solvents, namely water and dimethyl sulphoxide (DMSO). The gas phase potential energy curves for the 2-norbornyl chlorides are computed by ab initio methods and these curves are fitted into a 12-6-1 potential for use in classical molecular dynamics simulations. The gas phase potential energy curves indicate a greater barrier for the dissociation of the endo 2-norbornyl chloride (than the exo). The potentials of mean force (PMF) in DMSO and water indicate the locations and the magnitudes of the activation barriers in these solutions and are sensitive functions of the fitted gas phase potentials.
